item.title: NSF 3 Year Graduate Fellowship Information Session to be held Feb. 18th
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 18, 2026 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - The NSF GRFP provides 3 years of salary and tuition for Masters and PhD students in 30+ STEM fields. Rensselaer students earn this prestigious award every year. Seniors, 1st year grad students (fall 2026) who are U.S. citizens and permanent residents are eligible. Email madige@rpi.edu for information or Register for the virtual session: https://surveys.rpi.edu/jfe/form/SV_6L3FFwv0qCROrvE

item.title: Study Abroad Application Portal Open!
item.description: Are you an undergraduate student who is ready to study abroad? The application portal for summer/fall ’26 & AY ’26-’27 is open! Application deadlines are March 1 for affiliated exchanges and April 1 for non-affiliated study abroad. Visit the Education Abroad website for more information and application instructions: https://isss.rpi.edu/education-abroad/program-information/application-process-and-deadlines. Have questions? Contact Karen Dvorak, Education Abroad Program Manager, dvorak2@rpi.edu.

item.title: Division of Finance - The Controller’s Office is Moving!
item.description: The Finance teams that were located downtown in the Proctor’s Building will be moving! Effective February 17, 2026, the Accounting, Accounts Payable, FAST, Payroll, RAF, and Tax teams, will be located in the Troy Building, 5th Floor. Effective on or about March 2, 2026, the Procurement Office will be located at 185 Jordan Rd, Rensselaer Technology Park. Contact information for the teams remains the same. Please contact Debbie Maloney (malond6@rpi.edu, x6426) if you have any questions.

item.title: Kipu Quantum Iskay Optimizer — Onboarding Workshop for RPI Students and Researchers
item.description: RPI is in the process of onboarding Kipu Quantum Iskay Optimizer. The solver will be available via the IBM Quantum Qiskit Catalogue in the near future. To help you you with Iskay Optimizer you are invited to a concise, high-impact onboarding workshop to be held: Wednesday, February 18th at 9:30 AM in CII 3206. If your work involves optimization, scheduling, routing, portfolio design, materials discovery, or related areas, this session is for you. Please click in for more details.

item.title: Coming Soon! Staging Grounds Arts Festival
item.description: February 20-28, 2026 staging grounds Arts Festival 2026 is a platform of performances, open installations, and public programs. New commissions by Korakrit Arunanondchai and Jewyo Rhii, with additional artworks by Na Mira, Samson Young, and Li Yi-Fan explore how art, cultural memory, and experience are shaped by structures that re-animate events across time. Festival Korakrit Arunanondchai, Li Yi-Fan, Na Mira, Jewyo Rhii, and Samson Young

item.title: Mercer X Project Management Q&A Seminar and Hands-on Workshop with Monica Johns (TTM Technologies)
item.description: Come to our Mercer X Scrum/Agile Project Management Q&A Session (Friday, February 20th) and/or Hands-on Workshop (Saturday, February 21st) with Monica Johns (TTM Technologies)! We have Sticky notes, Poster paper, a Mercer XLab dynamic workspace, and a veteran project management professional to help organize your projects. Join us for an engaging, hands-on workshop designed to introduce (or deepen) your understanding of Scrum and Agile methodologies from Project Management. BYOP!

item.title: Webinar Friday February 20: Webex Application Training
item.description: Join us on Friday, February 20, from 11am-12pm for a hands-on Webex Training Session, part of the MMS Collaboration Software Training series. This session focuses on the Webex application and its integration with Outlook and Blackboard, so you can efficiently schedule, launch, and manage meetings directly from the tools you use every day. Register now: https://rensselaer.webex.com/webappng/sites/rensselaer/webinar/webinarSeries/register/783d951c6ab8482e9198a7bd6075a700

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar: Supervisory Essentials
item.description: In this seminar, Managers and Supervisors will learn from each other and our Facilitators about important topics such as the Employee Value Proposition and Employee Experience, the six fundamental Leadership competencies at Rensselaer, and experience a “day in the life” of a Supervisor. In addition, the importance of managing employee performance, providing both rewards and recognition, employment law fundamentals and tools for building team capacity will be explored. For more information…
